required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Concomitant Use of Hepatitis A Vaccine With Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella Vaccine and Pneumococcal 7-Valent Conjugate Vaccine in Healthy 12-Month-Old Children (V251-067)
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Randomized, Multicenter Study of the Safety, Tolerability, & Immunogenicity of VAQTA™ Given Concomitantly With PROQUAD™ and PREVNAR™ in Healthy Children 12 Months of Age

brief_summary.textblock: Hepatitis A vaccine will be given either alone or together with measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccine and pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine at the first dose and together with measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella [Oka/Merck] virus vaccine at the second dose. Immunogenicity and safety data will be collected after each dose of vaccine.

detailed_description.textblock:
Vaccines: V251, Hepatitis A Vaccine, Inactivated (VAQTA™) administered with Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella Vaccine (ProQuad™) and Pneumococcal 7-Valent Conjugate Vaccine (Prevnar™) will have a Duration of Treatment: 2 Doses, 6 months apart.
Vaccine: Hepatitis A Vaccine, Inactivated (VAQTA™), administered alone will have a Duration of Treatment: 2 Doses, 6 months apart.

primary_outcome.measure: Antibody Response to Hepatitis A - Participants With a Serological Response
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks Postdose 2 of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™)
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with titer ≥10 mIU/mL, i.e., seropositive for hepatitis A antibody, regardless of initial serostatus

primary_outcome.measure: Antibody Response to Varicella - Participants With a Serological Response
primary_outcome.description: Participants with varicella baseline antibody titer <1.25 gpELISA units/mL and Postdose 1 titers ≥1.25 gpELISA units/mL (seroconversion) and ≥5 gpELISA units/mL (seroprotection)

primary_outcome.measure: Antibody Response to Streptococcus Pneumoniae - Geometric Mean Titers
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks Postvaccination of pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine (Prevnar™)
primary_outcome.description: Serum antibodies to serotype-specific pneumococcal polysaccharides were determined by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With 1 or More Systemic Adverse Experience
primary_outcome.description: Systemic adverse experiences are unfavorable or unintended changes in the body after getting study vaccine. They are collected the first 14 days after receipt of dose 1 of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™) (Days 1 to 14) within the 6 week study period.

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With 1 or More Systemic Adverse Experience
primary_outcome.description: Systemic adverse experiences are unfavorable or unintended changes in the body after getting study vaccine. They are collected the first 14 days after receipt of dose 2 of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™) (Days 1 to 14) within the 4 week study period.

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With 1 or More Systemic Adverse Experience.
primary_outcome.description: Systemic adverse experiences are unfavorable or unintended changes in the body after getting study vaccine. Collected the first 14 days after each of the 2 doses of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™) (Days 1 to 14), given 6 months apart

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With 1 or More Injection-site Adverse Experience
primary_outcome.description: Injection-site adverse experiences collected the first 5 days after receipt of dose 1 of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™) (Days 1 to 5) within the 6 week study period.

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With 1 or More Injection-site Adverse Experience
primary_outcome.description: Injection-site adverse experiences collected the first 5 days after receipt of dose 2 of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™) (Days 1 to 5) within the 4 week study period.

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With 1 or More Injection-site Adverse Experience
primary_outcome.description: Injection-site adverse experiences collected the first 5 days after receipt of each dose of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™) (Days 1 to 5) over the 6 months in which the 2 doses of vaccine were administered.
Elevated temperatures measured the first 5 days after receipt of dose 1 of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™) (Days 1 to 5) within the 6 week study period.
Elevated temperatures measured the first 5 days after receipt of dose 2 of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™) (Days 1 to 5) within the 4 week study period.
Elevated temperatures measured the first 5 days after receipt of each dose of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™) (Days 1 to 5) over the 6 months in which the 2 doses of vaccine were administered.

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With 1 or More Serious Vaccine-related Adverse Experience
primary_outcome.description: Serious vaccine-related adverse experience causes death, persistent or significant disability, causes or prolong a hospital stay, is a cancer, an overdose, or life-threatening. They were collected during the entire study and believed due to study vaccine

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With 1 or More Serious Vaccine-related Adverse Experience
primary_outcome.description: Serious vaccine-related adverse experience causes death, persistent or significant disability, causes or prolong a hospital stay, is a cancer, an overdose, or life-threatening. They were collected during the entire study and believed due to study vaccine

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With 1 or More Serious Vaccine-related Adverse Experience
primary_outcome.description: Serious vaccine-related adverse experience causes death, persistent or significant disability, causes or prolong a hospital stay, is a cancer, an overdose, or life-threatening. They were collected during the entire study and believed due to study vaccine

other_outcome.measure: Antibody Response to Hepatitis A - Geometric Mean Titer
other_outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks Postdose 2 of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™)
other_outcome.description: Geometric Mean Titer of hepatitis A antibody, regardless of initial serostatus

other_outcome.measure: Antibody Response to Varicella - Geometric Mean Titer
other_outcome.description: Geometric Mean Titer of varicella antibody, baseline antibody titer was <1.25 gpELISA units/mL

other_outcome.measure: Antibody Response to S. Pneumoniae Serotype 4 - Participants With a Serological Response
other_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks postvaccination of pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine (Prevnar™)
other_outcome.description: Number of participants with a postvaccination titer >=0.2 mcg/mL for S. pneumoniae serotype 4

other_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks postvaccination of pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine (Prevnar™)
other_outcome.description: Number of participants with a postvaccination titer >=0.2 mcg/mL for S. pneumoniae serotype 6B

other_outcome.measure: Antibody Response to S. Pneumoniae Serotype 9V - Participants With a Serological Response
other_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks postvaccination of pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine (Prevnar™)
other_outcome.description: Number of participants with a postvaccination titer >=0.2 mcg/mL for S. pneumoniae serotype 9V

other_outcome.measure: Antibody Response to S. Pneumoniae Serotype 14 - Participants With a Serological Response
other_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks postvaccination of pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine (Prevnar™)
other_outcome.description: Number of participants with a postvaccination titer >=0.2 mcg/mL for S. pneumoniae serotype 14

other_outcome.measure: Antibody Response to S. Pneumoniae Serotype 18C - Participants With a Serological Response
other_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks postvaccination of pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine (Prevnar™)
other_outcome.description: Number of participants with a postvaccination titer >=0.2 mcg/mL for S. pneumoniae serotype 18C

other_outcome.measure: Antibody Response to S. Pneumoniae Serotype 19F - Participants With a Serological Response
other_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks postvaccination of pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine (Prevnar™)
other_outcome.description: Number of participants with a postvaccination titer >=0.2 mcg/mL for S. pneumoniae serotype 19F

other_outcome.measure: Antibody Response to S. Pneumoniae Serotype 23F - Participants With a Serological Response
other_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks postvaccination of pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine (Prevnar™)
other_outcome.description: Number of participants with a postvaccination titer >=0.2 mcg/mL for S. pneumoniae serotype 23F

arm_group.description: Arm 1: VAQTA™ 0.5 mL injection (2 doses 6 months apart), ProQuad™ 0.5 mL injection (2 doses 6 months apart), Prevnar™ 0.5 mL injection (one dose), all vaccines administered concomitantly. 28 weeks of study duration.

Arm 2: ProQuad™ 0.5 mL injection (2 doses ~8 months apart), Prevnar™ 0.5 mL injection (one dose), both administered concomitantly, VAQTA™ 0.5 mL injection (2 doses 6 months apart) administered alone. 34 weeks of study duration.

intervention.intervention_name: Comparator: ProQuad™ (Measles, Mumps, Rubella and Varicella vaccine)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 12- to 15-month-old males and females with no active liver disease
- A negative history of hepatitis A, measles, mumps, rubella, chickenpox, and/or zoster
Exclusion Criteria:
- Males and females previously vaccinated with hepatitis A, measles, mumps, rubella, and/or chickenpox vaccine
- Any immune deficiency
- History of allergy to any of the vaccine components
- History of any seizure disorder

link.description: MedWatch - FDA maintained medical product safety Information
Merck: Patient & Caregiver U.S. Product Web Site

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 39 clinical sites in the United States Date first participant visit: 14-Apr-2006 Date last participant visit: 25-Mar-2008

group.title: Arm 1: VAQTA™ + ProQuad™ + Prevnar™
group.description: VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine) + ProQuad™ (measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccine) + Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine) administered at the same time at first study visit. Second doses of VAQTA™ and ProQuad™ administered together 24 weeks later at third study visit.

group.title: Arm 2: VAQTA™ Separate From ProQuad™ and Prevnar™
group.description: VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine) dose 1 administered separately from ProQuad™ (measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccine) and Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine). A second dose of VAQTA™ administered 24 weeks after the first dose at third study visit.

group.title: Arm 1: VAQTA™ + ProQuad™ + Prevnar™
group.description: VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine) + ProQuad™ (measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccine) + Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine) administered at the same time at first study visit. Second doses of VAQTA™ and ProQuad™ administered together 24 weeks later at third study visit.

group.title: Arm 2: VAQTA™ Separate From ProQuad™ and Prevnar™
group.description: VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine) dose 1 administered separately from ProQuad™ (measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccine) and Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine). A second dose of VAQTA™ administered 24 weeks after the first dose at third study visit.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male

outcome.title: Antibody Response to Hepatitis A - Participants With a Serological Response
outcome.description: Number of participants with titer ≥10 mIU/mL, i.e., seropositive for hepatitis A antibody, regardless of initial serostatus
outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks Postdose 2 of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™)
outcome.population: Per-protocol analysis set includes participants who received 2 doses of VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine), had a Postdose 2 serology results, and followed the protocol procedures.

group.title: Arm 1: VAQTA™ + ProQuad™ + Prevnar™
group.description: VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine) + ProQuad™ (measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccine) + Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine) administered at the same time at first study visit. Second doses of VAQTA™ and ProQuad™ administered together 24 weeks later at third study visit.

group.title: Arm 2: VAQTA™ Separate From ProQuad™ and Prevnar™
group.description: VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine) dose 1 administered separately from ProQuad™ (measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccine) and Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine). A second dose of VAQTA™ administered 24 weeks after the first dose at third study visit.

measure.title: Antibody Response to Hepatitis A - Participants With a Serological Response
measure.description: Number of participants with titer ≥10 mIU/mL, i.e., seropositive for hepatitis A antibody, regardless of initial serostatus
measure.population: Per-protocol analysis set includes participants who received 2 doses of VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine), had a Postdose 2 serology results, and followed the protocol procedures.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of the difference (percentage points) in estimated response rates of Arm 1 – Arm 2.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Similarity (non-inferiority) based on lower bound of the 2-sided 95% CI on the risk difference of seroresponse rates excluding a decrease of 10 percentage points or more (lower bound >-10.0).
analysis.p_value_desc: Similarity (non-inferiority) indicated that the risk difference was statistically significantly greater than the pre-specified clinically relevant difference of -10 percentage points at the 1-sided α=0.025 level.
analysis.method_desc: For testing the non-inferiority of 2 proportions. Stratified by investigator.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference in estimated response rates of Arm 1 – Arm 2.

outcome.title: Antibody Response to Varicella - Participants With a Serological Response
outcome.description: Participants with varicella baseline antibody titer <1.25 gpELISA units/mL and Postdose 1 titers ≥1.25 gpELISA units/mL (seroconversion) and ≥5 gpELISA units/mL (seroprotection)
outcome.population: Per-protocol analysis set includes participants who received the initial dose of ProQuad™ (varicella-containing vaccine), had a Postdose 1 serology result, and followed the protocol procedures.

group.title: Arm 1: VAQTA™ + ProQuad™ + Prevnar™
group.description: VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine) + ProQuad™ (measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccine) + Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine) administered at the same time at first study visit. Second doses of VAQTA™ and ProQuad™ administered together 24 weeks later at third study visit.

group.title: Arm 2: VAQTA™ Separate From ProQuad™ and Prevnar™
group.description: VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine) dose 1 administered separately from ProQuad™ (measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccine) and Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine). A second dose of VAQTA™ administered 24 weeks after the first dose at third study visit.

measure.title: Antibody Response to Varicella - Participants With a Serological Response
measure.description: Participants with varicella baseline antibody titer <1.25 gpELISA units/mL and Postdose 1 titers ≥1.25 gpELISA units/mL (seroconversion) and ≥5 gpELISA units/mL (seroprotection)
measure.population: Per-protocol analysis set includes participants who received the initial dose of ProQuad™ (varicella-containing vaccine), had a Postdose 1 serology result, and followed the protocol procedures.

analysis.groups_desc: Comparison of the difference (percentage points) in estimated response rates of Arm 1 – Arm 2 for participants with initial serostatus <1.25 gpELISA units/mL
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Similarity (non-inferiority) based on lower bound of the 2-sided 95% CI on the risk difference seroresponse rates excluding a decrease of 10 percentage points or more (lower bound >-10.0).
analysis.p_value_desc: Similarity (non-inferiority) indicated that the risk difference was statistically significantly greater than the pre-specified clinically relevant difference of -10 percentage points at the 1-sided multiplicity-adjusted α=0.025 level.
analysis.method_desc: For testing the non-inferiority of 2 proportions. Stratified by investigator.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference in estimated response rates of Arm 1 – Arm 2.

outcome.title: Antibody Response to Streptococcus Pneumoniae - Geometric Mean Titers
outcome.description: Serum antibodies to serotype-specific pneumococcal polysaccharides were determined by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay
outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks Postvaccination of pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine (Prevnar™)
outcome.population: Per-protocol analysis set includes participants who received Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine), had a postvaccination serology result, and followed the protocol procedures

measure.population: Per-protocol analysis set includes participants who received Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine), had a postvaccination serology result, and followed the protocol procedures

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority criterion is met if the lower bound of the 95% confidence interval of the response ratio is >0.5, excluding a decrease of 2-fold or more
analysis.estimate_desc: Response ratio is based on statistical models adjusting the GMT for combined study center and prevaccination titer

outcome.title: Participants With 1 or More Systemic Adverse Experience
outcome.description: Systemic adverse experiences are unfavorable or unintended changes in the body after getting study vaccine. They are collected the first 14 days after receipt of dose 1 of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™) (Days 1 to 14) within the 6 week study period.
outcome.population: Includes all participants who provided safety follow-up after receipt of Dose 1 of VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine)

group.title: Arm 1: VAQTA™ + ProQuad™ + Prevnar™
group.description: VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine) + ProQuad™ (measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccine) + Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine) administered at the same time at first study visit. group.title: Arm 2: VAQTA™ Separate From ProQuad™ and Prevnar™
group.description: VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine) dose 1 administered separately from ProQuad™ (measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccine) and Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine). A second dose of VAQTA™ administered 24 weeks after the first dose at third study visit.

measure.title: Participants With Elevated Temperature (≥102.2F/ ≥39.0C)
measure.description: Elevated temperatures measured the first 5 days after receipt of dose 1 of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™) (Days 1 to 5) within the 6 week study period.
measure.population: Includes all participants who provided safety follow-up after receipt of Dose 1 of VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine)

outcome.title: Participants With Elevated Temperature (≥102.2F/ ≥39.0C)
outcome.description: Elevated temperatures measured the first 5 days after receipt of dose 2 of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™) (Days 1 to 5) within the 4 week study period.
outcome.population: Includes all participants who provided safety follow-up after receipt of Dose 2 of VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine)

group.title: Arm 1: VAQTA™ + ProQuad™ + Prevnar™
group.description: VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine) + ProQuad™ (measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccine) + Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine) administered at the same time at first study visit. Second doses of VAQTA™ and ProQuad™ administered together 24 weeks later at third study visit.

group.title: Arm 2: VAQTA™ Separate From ProQuad™ and Prevnar™
group.description: VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine) dose 1 administered separately from ProQuad™ (measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccine) and Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine). A second dose of VAQTA™ administered 24 weeks after the first dose at third study visit.

measure.title: Participants With Elevated Temperature (≥102.2F/ ≥39.0C)
measure.description: Elevated temperatures measured the first 5 days after receipt of dose 2 of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™) (Days 1 to 5) within the 4 week study period.
measure.population: Includes all participants who provided safety follow-up after receipt of Dose 2 of VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine)

outcome.title: Participants With Elevated Temperature (≥102.2F/ ≥39.0C)
outcome.description: Elevated temperatures measured the first 5 days after receipt of each dose of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™) (Days 1 to 5) over the 6 months in which the 2 doses of vaccine were administered.
outcome.population: Includes all participants who provided safety follow-up after receipt of any dose of VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine)

group.title: Arm 1: VAQTA™ + ProQuad™ + Prevnar™
group.description: VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine) + ProQuad™ (measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccine) + Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine) administered at the same time at first study visit. outcome.title: Participants With 1 or More Serious Vaccine-related Adverse Experience
outcome.description: Serious vaccine-related adverse experience causes death, persistent or significant disability, causes or prolong a hospital stay, is a cancer, an overdose, or life-threatening. They were collected during the entire study and believed due to study vaccine
outcome.population: Includes all participants who provided safety follow-up after receipt of Dose 1 of VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine)

outcome.title: Antibody Response to Hepatitis A – Geometric Mean Titer
outcome.description: Geometric Mean Titer of hepatitis A antibody, regardless of initial serostatus
outcome.time_frame: 4 weeks Postdose 2 of hepatitis A vaccine (VAQTA™)
outcome.population: Per-protocol analysis set includes participants who received 2 doses of VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine), had a Postdose 2 serology results, and followed the protocol procedures

group.title: Arm 1: VAQTA™ + ProQuad™ + Prevnar™
group.description: VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine) + ProQuad™ (measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccine) + Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine) administered at the same time at first study visit. measure.title: Antibody Response to Hepatitis A – Geometric Mean Titer
measure.description: Geometric Mean Titer of hepatitis A antibody, regardless of initial serostatus
measure.population: Per-protocol analysis set includes participants who received 2 doses of VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine), had a Postdose 2 serology results, and followed the protocol procedures

outcome.title: Antibody Response to Varicella - Geometric Mean Titer
outcome.description: Geometric Mean Titer of varicella antibody, baseline antibody titer was <1.25 gpELISA units/mL
outcome.population: Per-protocol analysis set includes participants who received the initial dose of ProQuad™ (varicella-containing vaccine), had a Postdose 1 serology result, and followed the protocol procedures

group.title: Arm 1: VAQTA™ + ProQuad™ + Prevnar™
group.description: VAQTA™ (hepatitis A vaccine) + ProQuad™ (measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella vaccine) + Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine) administered at the same time at first study visit. measure.title: Antibody Response to Varicella - Geometric Mean Titer
measure.description: Geometric Mean Titer of varicella antibody, baseline antibody titer was <1.25 gpELISA units/mL
measure.population: Per-protocol analysis set includes participants who received the initial dose of ProQuad™ (varicella-containing vaccine), had a Postdose 1 serology result, and followed the protocol procedures

outcome.title: Antibody Response to S. Pneumoniae Serotype 4 - Participants With a Serological Response
outcome.description: Number of participants with a postvaccination titer >=0.2 mcg/mL for S. pneumoniae serotype 4
outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks postvaccination of pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine (Prevnar™)
outcome.population: Per-protocol analysis set includes participants who received Prevnar™ (pneumococcal 7-valent conjugate vaccine), had a postvaccination serology result, and followed the protocol procedures. Serotype 4 is one of 7 individual serotypes contained in Prevnar™.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
